model_answer: The correct timeline is: (2) Title 'An Introduction to the Scratch Programming Language' shown; narrator says Scratch is easy, visual, fun. (4) 'Where Do I Get Scratch' slide shown; narrator asks 'So where do you get Scratch?' and cites MIT Media Lab. (5) Instruction to visit scratch.mit.edu and click 'Download Scratch' is shown and said. (1) Form with email/name appears; narrator says under-13 shouldn't fill email. (3) OS choices screen appears; narrator tells to click the program to download. (6) 'Starting Scratch' slide shows desktop icon/Start menu; narrator says 'so let's get started.' Therefore, the answer is A: 4 -> 2 -> 5 -> 1 -> 3 -> 6.

The correct timeline is: (2) On white stage, narrator introduces 'sprite' on a 'stage' and block categories. (3) Cat moves 100 steps, turns 90Â°, goes off stage; he drags it back. (1) Repeat loop added around move/turn four times; narrator says it looked too fast. (4) 'Wait 1 sec' block inserted to slow the loop. (5) Pen is set down so motion draws a shape. (6) Narrator proposes changing the plain white background. (7) Desert background is imported and the cat runs on it. (8) A bat sprite is chosen from 'New Sprite' and flies.

Therefore, the answer is A: 2 -> 3 -> 1 -> 5 -> 4 -> 6 -> 7 -> 8.
